document_data.name: Abu bin Sujah
document_data.mainbody: '''Abu bin Sujah''' was a renowned [[Zakharan (ethnicity)|Zakharan]] [[desert rider]] who sought the fabled city of [[Suj (city)|Suj]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: Sujah wore voluminous, white desert robes, crowned with a white [[turban]]. He wore leather [[riding boots]], and carried a curved [[longsword]] in a scabbard attached to his waist. He had tan skin and a short, black goatee.
document_data.Abilities: He was considered to be the foremost horseman of his people.
document_data.Possessions: Sujah's sword was magically enchanted, and was especially powerful when wielded against [[genie]]s. His horse, named "Hisan", was outfitted with a ''[[bridle of speed]]''.
document_data.Activites: Owing to his great skill at mounted combat, Sujah was entrusted to lead his people in raids against other tribes. He became interested in the ''[[seals of the princes]]'', said to have been secreted away in the mythical city of Suj.
